I bought this on sale and still have remorse. 

-Too boring for 20$ there is likely another game out there that you'd enjoy more that costs less. Any number of things for $20 that you would enjoy more, even if a fan of the films 

-Too much DLC and some is poorly rated

-Small community and no real teamwork or meta. 

you are essentially alone together. left to assume what everyone else is doing. People may or may not help you to some degree. That will likely run away from you if you screw up at all. Regardless, there isn't a feeling of "closeness" or reward between the survivors outside of rescuing someone or being rescued. You sneak around looking for an opportunity to repair a generator. An overly simple and frustrating task. A simple "skill check" where you must tap your spacebar within a brief window of time. if you succeed you speed up the repair of the generator to help restore power, open a gate and escape. if you fail, a loud noise reveals your position and halts the repair process with there being 5-10 skill checks for generator and several generators to open a gate. an interesting and simple mechanic, but unfortunately the only thing there is to being a survivor and winning outside of stealth. there are a few characters you can play with slightly different attributes, and a few different ways of augmenting or equipping them at the start of the round. but there is little to no difference between them all. 

For most people who enjoy spooky stuff, it might be fun to play casually for a couple weeks out of the year near Halloween, or periodically year round for big fans of the films, but, ultimately the game lacks complexity and options to be competitive. The mode is too simple and the maps are too flat and boring. And whatever unlockables there are that offer some amount of depth or different play styles must be meticulously obtained from excessive grinding. And if you want to play as the iconic killers you'll have to fork over more money. 

I don't like giving a negative review. I think its a great concept and has appeal but unfortunately it falls short. And it only becomes obvious after a few hours of play. I did have a few good rounds, even where i died just at the gate, but not before helping ensure two of my team mates survived in my sacrifice. So if you have friends who are hyped about playing, or you like hunting defenseless people.. you may enjoy it. otherwise i can't recommend it.

Game punishes new players by matching them up against veteran players with most if not all perk advantages at their disposal. If you can't pick this game up quick good luck having any fun with it. Game had potential but the learning curve is too steep and from what the community has told me the game devs could care less. Money, money, money. If you can pick games up quickly give it a shot, if you are a casual gamer give it a pass in my opinion. Im not having fun.

This game, is a great masterpiece! The concept, the idea are so damn unique. Although the current state of this game can't be classified as 'horror' because of the current meta, and many has said that this game sucks because of the survivors or whatever mechanics, etc. But for me, this game is getting better and better overtime, it's improving but the devs will need more time. If you are planning to buy this game then I highly recommend it, they have plan in the upcoming 2nd year anniversary to balance the game and more. It will worth your money.

I've just finished the game and I only recommend it to those who seek to have a brain aneurism. The game is riddled with bugs and more inconsistent that politics in the middle east. Each patch and update introduces more bugs that they fix. The devs let the players playtest and then shit on many of the results. 
There are these things called â€œtotemsâ€. A killer can equip abilities that rely on a specific totem to not be found by survivors. These totems can either spawn under a mountain of boxes, huddled into a corner or just in the plain open, slap dap in the middle of the field. The killer does not get to choose the totem! 
The general movement is weird as well. Want to run up these stairs? Did you know that your left pinkie finger strayed the hand rail? Enjoy stopping mid sprint like you ran into a wall. : - ) 
Map design is also rather â€¦ unique. Each time a new map is released it orientates towards the killer that is released with it. Sounds swell. Except that all other killers are disregarded in these considerations. So when playing killer just know that there is a 50% chance that the map you get sucks and youâ€™ll lose just because you were too bad of a gamer to have rng give you a good map.
The last thing is balancing. Over at bhvr time is scarce because theyâ€™re working on new monetisable content shove up their spaghetti code so game balance has to be broad and for everyone. So they balance around the average player, meaning that both low and high level balance is ignored for the medium level.
So in conclusion: If youâ€™re up for a cocaine induced round of russian roulette via bad programming, balance and game design, get this. Otherwise just watch it on You Tube. Having it cut together may save your sanity.
Btw.: Art team carries this game

Dead by Daylight ist wirklich  weiterzuempfehlen, weil man nach einer bestimmten Zeit immer mehr Lust darauf hat, es zu spielen. Ich selbst spiele zwar hauptsÃ¤chlich nur Killer, aber Survivor zu spielen ist auch zimelich lustig. Manchmal schreckt man sich so sehr wegen dem Killer (vor allem Myers und Pig) aber das ist nicht gruselig, sondern einfach nur zum lachen. Echt ein tolles Spiel. Hoffentlich kommen wieder coole, neue DLCs. Aber falls man beginnt Killer zu spielen, sollte man mit Trapper oder Wraith beginnen weil sie am leichtesten zu spielen sind. Weiter so Behaviour :)

I've spent about 300 hours on ps4 and roughly half of that on steam.  Typically each season I have been high tier survivor and mid to high killer.  I can't recomend this game to anyone.  There's obviously a love hate to the game but this final straw is this emblem system.  The community is unbearably toxic, the devs consistantly take the game in the wrong direction, people ruin your game, be it selfish/clueless teammates or cheap killers.  Watching the dev stream shows how out of touch they are, as there are serious issues with mechanics and balance and they ignore them constantly.  Insidous killers hiding in the basement, face camping and OP killers ruin it for survivors.  Trolling survivors who run 1 perk because they think they're great and consistant pallet looping and purple flashlights ruin it for average killers.  Honestly this game was much better shortly after launch than it is now.  High tier players are intentionally de ranking just to find games because it's impossible for casual players to rank up now.  These devs are clueless and the community just adds insult to injury.  The frustration just isn't worth the time.  Que the "Thinks this is funny" nerds

EDIT: They've updated the emblem system, much more balanced and easier to rank up.

EDIT 2: it's 2k19 and this game somehow got worse.  The new killer is actually broken. The perk reworking has made the game less enjoyable for both survivor and killer. The community is just as brain dead as ever.  I just had a game with a teammate from Germany and also one from Mexico in the same lobby.  Doing a pretty good job so far I'd say.
